page.title: 08Local Agriculture
page.content: We use combine harvesters to harvest our wheat, barley, oats and rape. We use tractors to plough the land and potato harvesters to lift the potatoes although some farms still only turn them onto the soil whereas the new machines will riddle and pack them. The straw from the corn harvest is baled for use in the winter months. Many of the farmers in this area have both livestock and crops although two out of three farmers in Marton le Moor only own arable land. The farmers who own livestock mostly have cows and or sheep, not many pigs are bred in this area. Most of the cows are bred for meat or to be sold at market. One farmer breeds pedigree Charolais and has won several prizes including Supreme Champion at the Royal Agricultural Show in 1982.
